item.title: My Food Struggle In Pictures: When What I Ate Made Me 'Good' Or 'Bad'
item.description: May 7, 2017 - For the writer and her sister, the family's tendency to talk about food choices in moral terms triggered an unhealthy obsession with eating and a skewed sense of self-worth.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 7, 2017 - For the writer and her sister, the family's tendency to talk about food choices in moral terms triggered an unhealthy obsession with eating and a skewed sense of self-worth. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/07/525568821/my-food-struggle-in-pictures-when-what-i-ate-made-me-good-or-bad

item.title: Don't Count On The Senate To Save Obamacare, Or To Save The House
item.description: May 7, 2017 - The leaders and rank-and-file of the House know that what they have done so far is not yet law. It may not even qualify as a rough draft. Giant steps remain, and some in the GOP may well be grateful.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 7, 2017 - The leaders and rank-and-file of the House know that what they have done so far is not yet law. It may not even qualify as a rough draft. Giant steps remain, and some in the GOP may well be grateful. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/07/527127968/dont-count-on-the-senate-to-save-obamacare-or-to-save-the-house

item.title: Quest For Beauty In Colombia Sometimes Ends In Tragedy
item.description: May 7, 2017 - A mishap in Colombia highlights the dark side of cosmetic work in a country that is a hot spot for body rehabbing. Each year, hundreds of thousands of procedures are performed on locals and tourists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 7, 2017 - A mishap in Colombia highlights the dark side of cosmetic work in a country that is a hot spot for body rehabbing. Each year, hundreds of thousands of procedures are performed on locals and tourists. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/07/526863774/quest-for-beauty-in-colombia-sometimes-ends-in-tragedy

item.title: As GOP Health Care Push Moves To Senate, White House Questions Value of CBO Analysis
item.description: May 6, 2017 - "I think I know the gospel pretty well," a White House spokeswoman said after the House passed a health care bill without the official legislative scoring, "and I'd say the CBO is not the gospel."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 6, 2017 - "I think I know the gospel pretty well," a White House spokeswoman said after the House passed a health care bill without the official legislative scoring, "and I'd say the CBO is not the gospel." http://www.npr.org/2017/05/06/526866697/as-gop-health-care-push-moves-to-senate-white-house-questions-value-of-cbo-analy

item.title: Businesses Push Back On Paid-Sick-Leave Laws
item.description: May 6, 2017 - Dozens of states and cities require businesses to offer paid sick leave. But some employers are looking for ways to pre-empt those requirements, including at the federal level.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 6, 2017 - Dozens of states and cities require businesses to offer paid sick leave. But some employers are looking for ways to pre-empt those requirements, including at the federal level. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/06/527053441/businesses-push-back-on-paid-sick-leave-laws

item.title: Female Genital Mutilation: What It Does To A Woman
item.description: May 6, 2017 - The charges brought against two U.S. doctors for alleged female genital mutilation brought renewed attention to the ritual. We interview a World Health Organization specialist to learn more.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 6, 2017 - The charges brought against two U.S. doctors for alleged female genital mutilation brought renewed attention to the ritual. We interview a World Health Organization specialist to learn more. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/05/06/526766230/female-genital-mutilation-what-it-does-to-a-woman

item.title: Leaked Document Indicates Big Proposed Cuts To Drug Czar's Office
item.description: May 5, 2017 - President Trump campaigned on fighting the opioid crisis. Now a preliminary White House budget document, obtained by NPR, calls for significant cuts to the office quarterbacking the federal response.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - President Trump campaigned on fighting the opioid crisis. Now a preliminary White House budget document, obtained by NPR, calls for significant cuts to the office quarterbacking the federal response. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/05/527076657/leaked-document-indicates-big-proposed-cuts-to-drug-czars-office

item.title: People With Pre-Existing Conditions Worry About Losing Health Coverage
item.description: May 5, 2017 - As the American Health Care Act moves toward the Senate, many people around the country are reacting to it. Among them, people with pre-existing conditions who worry about losing their coverage.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - As the American Health Care Act moves toward the Senate, many people around the country are reacting to it. Among them, people with pre-existing conditions who worry about losing their coverage. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/05/527092485/people-with-pre-existing-conditions-worry-about-losing-health-coverage

item.title: Obamacare Vs. American Health Care Act: Here's Where They Differ
item.description: May 5, 2017 - NPR looks at how the Affordable Care Act and American Health Care Act differ in terms of insurance marketplaces, the individual mandate, guaranteed coverage and insurance subsidies.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - NPR looks at how the Affordable Care Act and American Health Care Act differ in terms of insurance marketplaces, the individual mandate, guaranteed coverage and insurance subsidies. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/05/527092478/obamacare-vs-american-health-care-act-heres-where-they-differ

item.title: Advocates Support Efforts To Install Public Changing Tables For Disabled Adults
item.description: May 5, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Sabrina Kimball, founder of Universal Changing Places, an organization that advocates for public areas to have adult changing tables for disabled adults and the elderly.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Sabrina Kimball, founder of Universal Changing Places, an organization that advocates for public areas to have adult changing tables for disabled adults and the elderly. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/05/527092464/advocates-support-efforts-to-install-public-changing-tables-for-disabled-adults

item.title: House Approval Of Health Care Bill Represents Major Victory For Trump
item.description: May 5, 2017 - President Trump is still learning the ways of Washington. But House passage of the health care bill is a victory for the novice politician.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - President Trump is still learning the ways of Washington. But House passage of the health care bill is a victory for the novice politician. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/05/527092428/house-approval-of-health-care-bill-represents-major-victory-for-trump

item.title: Why Taste Buds Dull As We Age
item.description: May 5, 2017 - You're born with roughly 9,000 taste buds, and they're very good at regenerating — which is why you can recover the ability to taste just days after burning your tongue. But that can change as we age.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - You're born with roughly 9,000 taste buds, and they're very good at regenerating — which is why you can recover the ability to taste just days after burning your tongue. But that can change as we age. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/05/05/526750174/why-taste-buds-dull-as-we-age

item.title: Health Care Vote Could Threaten Republican House Majority
item.description: May 5, 2017 - Some of the most vulnerable House Republicans voted in favor of the GOP health care plan — and Democrats are already trying to use it against them ahead of the 2018 midterm elections.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - Some of the most vulnerable House Republicans voted in favor of the GOP health care plan — and Democrats are already trying to use it against them ahead of the 2018 midterm elections. http://www.npr.org/2017/05/05/526969730/health-care-vote-could-threaten-republican-house-majority

item.title: Measuring Drug Impairment In Drivers Is Easier Said Than Done
item.description: May 5, 2017 - A report on the potential influence of alcohol or drug impairment on traffic fatalities points to the difficulty of comparing alcohol impairment standards to other drugs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 5, 2017 - A report on the potential influence of alcohol or drug impairment on traffic fatalities points to the difficulty of comparing alcohol impairment standards to other drugs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/05/526264342/measuring-drug-impairment-in-drivers-is-easier-said-than-done

item.title: 5 Things To Watch As GOP Health Bill Moves To The Senate
item.description: May 4, 2017 - Just three "no" votes by Senate Republicans would likely be enough to sink the GOP health bill. Democrats who lost the battle in the House are still convinced they can win the political war.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: May 4, 2017 - Just three "no" votes by Senate Republicans would likely be enough to sink the GOP health bill. Democrats who lost the battle in the House are still convinced they can win the political war. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/05/04/526922980/gop-health-bill-moves-to-the-senate-5-things-to-watch
